intro: Tricalysia pedunculosa var. pedunculosa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, elliptic leaves that are often dark green. Its flowers, which come in shades of white, pink, and purple, are borne on long peduncles and bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Tricalysia pedunculosa var. pedunculosa is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a popular ornamental plant.
